name: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysplasia with Subtalar Coalition
chief_complaint: My ankle keeps giving way and I have sharp pain on the inside of my foot when walking
physical_findings: Tenderness along posterior tibial tendon course
treatment: Custom orthotics with medial arch support
Stage-specific bracing (Arizona brace for flexible deformity)
prognosis: Guarded - depends on stage at diagnosis. Early intervention may prevent progression to rigid deformity but recurrence is common without strict adherence to postoperative protocols
description: A rare congenital variant combining dysplastic posterior tibial tendon fibers with fibrous subtalar coalition, leading to progressive adult-acquired flatfoot deformity. The dysplastic tendon fails to provide dynamic arch support while the coalition creates abnormal biomechanics, accelerating degenerative changes.
risk_factors: Family history of connective tissue disorders
